title-group.article-title: A royal encounter: space, spectacle and the Queen's visit to Ireland 2011

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2012 Royal Geographical Society (with the Institute of British Geographers)

abstract.p: This commentary reflects on the first official visit made by a British monarch to Ireland since its independence. Focusing on three key moments of Queen Elizabeth's itinerary — the Garden of Remembrance, the Irish National War Memorial, Islandbridge, and the state banquet, Dublin Castle — I suggest that efforts to simultaneously honour rebels/soldiers in acts of public remembrance sought to re-position the past between these two islands in ways which recognised conflict but also aspired towards reconciled understandings of how that past could be more peacefully calibrated.
